solution: The base of the hemisphere is a circle with radius 6 and area $6^2\pi=36\pi$.  The curved top of the hemisphere has half the surface area of a full sphere, which has surface area $4\pi(6^2)=144\pi$, so the curved top of the hemisphere has $144\pi/2=72\pi$.  The total surface area of the hemisphere is $36\pi+72\pi=\boxed{108\pi}$.
